Scende herself embodies all the fears of the Grif’empire. Draguean, Carrion, ally of the Phenicers, she keeps making her case worse by rallying the scattered remnants of the Black Archers, the legendary troop that laid waste to Efroth.

But is the empire right to focus on the threats without? What about the enemy within? The roads are no longer safe, the patricians have to rely on private militias to have their domains be respected when the imperial authority crumbles down.

And then, there is Oblivion. Hidden within scorched pages or dark secrets, it walks upon the W’Orld, maybe in the guise of an innocent creature…

995, Year of the Dame is a supplement for Les Chroniques des Féals – the world book and roleplaying game. You will find:

• The Exodin’s screen, providing some valuable tools to the game master, along with a superb representation of the imperial city, Aladarenche.

• A map of the W’Orld, large framed and in color, enabling you to follow the journeys of the fraternities in their fight against the Void.

• The 995, Year of the Dame booklet, developing the important events of this dire year, along with an original story that follows the one offered in the world book.

The whole being wonderfully illustrated by Nicolas Fructus and supervised by Mathieu Gaborit.

Do not shun Oblivion. Denying it would only make matters worse.

146495.name: Gaming in the 'Verse: Gen Con 2013 Preview
146495.description:
From the back of the book:

Thank you for picking up a copy of Gaming in the 'Verse!

This unique, limited edition game book includes two Firefly adventures from the Echoes of War line and material from the upcoming Firefly RPG.


Character Creation includes all nine crewmembers, 12 pre-generated archetypes, and original character generation.
Ship Creation includes step-by-step information on how to build your boat along with game rules for Serenity.
Episode Guide preview for "Serenity" and "The Train Job" comes with recap, adventure seeds, and character/ship rules.
Basic Rules provide everything you need to run and play a scenario in the 'Verse.
Wedding Planners, written by Margaret Weis, is a five-act Echoes of War adventure.
Shooting Fish is also a five act Echoes of War adventure, written by Andrew Peregrine.
Appendix includes Design Essays, Glossary, FAQ, Chinese Translation Guide, and The Sun System Atlas.

146496.description: The party game Bam! - Das unanständig gute Wortspiel – a.k.a. BAM! – challenges players to fill in the blank on a card text in order to impress the "BAM!-Master" as well as the other players. If, for example, the question is "Germany is looking for BAM!?", you try to find an answer card in your hand that fits the situation best – or worst, as the case may be...
146496.name: Bam!: Das unanständig gute Wortspiel

146497.name: Onslaught2
146497.description:
User Summary

Onslaught2 is a tower defense game in which you try to defend your base from being overrun by aliens. After you select the mode you wish to play on, (easy, medium or hard), choose one of the 12 maps and start spending your cash to buy and strategically place your towers. There are four towers to select from, each having an array of upgrades which expand the towers' capabilities. You can pause the game at any point to make your purchases and upgrades.
On the downside, alien numbers, strength and speed increase fast and you have only 10 lives before game over.

146498.name: Math Magic
146498.description: This game compendium uses a specialty deck of 108 cards. Each card contains two numbers and a geometric figure. Each game is designed to teach players the concepts of operations and shapes. The game comes with a booklet of twenty seven games.

146499.name: Jumpspace (Issue 1 - 1987)

rpgissuearticle.117633: Equipment Check: The Closed Circuit Diving Unit

146499.description:
From the Contents page:

JUMPSPACE is a quarterly published amateur fanzine devoted to Game Designers' Workshop's TRAVELLER role playing game.

146500.name: Owl Hoot Trail
146500.description:
Publisher blurb:

Owl Hoot Trail is a gritty Clint Eastwood western, set in a hostile fantasy world where half'in gunslingers ride out with shee scouts and hill folk preachers to escape the law, where mentalists cheat you at poker and gadgeteers build gizmos to keep undead off the range. Shee and half'ins and hill folk might exist in this world, but bullets hurt – hard. And there's a whole range of monsters roaming the lonesome prairie, just waiting for a tasty morsel like you to cross their path.

Half rules book, half adventure, Owl Hoot Trail showcases the adventure They Rode To Perdition, a multi-part mystery and starting campaign setting that’s centered on the little town of Perdition. With as close to an epic storyline as you'll find in a western setting, the PCs can change Perdition for good with their actions.

Using slimmed-down game mechanics you already know, the Old West of your imagination just got a lot more dangerous.
